A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
It's sad to see\, one of the biggest and best cultural phenomenas being slowly eaten by corporate greed\, and financial exploration. A Star Wars movie used to an event\, especially for dedicated fans - after the Disney buyout we cant go 5 feet anywhere in the world\, without being reminded to consume Star Wars. 
But then again\, what kind of franchise with the slightest name for itself isn't exploited these days? Or at least attempted.
A whole other level of sadness though\, is this forced female/multicultural/political correct agenda this movie blatantly displays - yeah we get it; all white men are evil\, and if you're a white male\, and not ashamed of yourself yet\, then this movie will make another radical attempt to make you feel so. All while celebrating animal freedom\, vegetarianism\, and empowered woman at the same time.
Star Wars just used to be great and fun action adventure movies\, that most people agreed were awesome. Not this demographically calculated soullessness with hidden political agendas.
